segment.source: Scenario 3 KMS Client Activation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Scenario 3 KMS Client Activation (Windows 10)

segment.source: Scenario 3 KMS Client Activation
segment.target: Scenario 3 KMS Client Activation

segment.source: Scenario 3: KMS Client Activation
segment.target: Scenario 3: KMS Client Activation

segment.source: In this scenario, you use the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) to activate Key Management Service (KMS) client keys or Generic Volume License Keys (GVLKs).
segment.target: In this scenario, you use the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) to activate Key Management Service (KMS) client keys or Generic Volume License Keys (GVLKs).

segment.source: This can be performed on either Core Network or Isolated Lab computers.
segment.target: This can be performed on either Core Network or Isolated Lab computers.

segment.source: By default, volume license editions of Windows Vista, Windows® 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server® 2012, and Microsoft® Office 2010 use KMS for activation.
segment.target: By default, volume license editions of Windows Vista, Windows® 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server® 2012, and Microsoft® Office 2010 use KMS for activation.

segment.source: GVLKs are already installed in volume license editions of these products.
segment.target: GVLKs are already installed in volume license editions of these products.

segment.source: You do not have to enter a key to activate a product as a GVLK, unless you are converting a MAK-activated product to a KMS activation.
segment.target: You do not have to enter a key to activate a product as a GVLK, unless you are converting a MAK-activated product to a KMS activation.

segment.source: For more information, see Install a KMS Client Key.
segment.target: For more information, see Install a KMS Client Key.

segment.source: The procedure that is described below assumes the following:
segment.target: The procedure that is described below assumes the following:

segment.source: The KMS Service is enabled and available to all KMS clients.
segment.target: The KMS Service is enabled and available to all KMS clients.

segment.source: VAMT has been installed and computers have been added to the VAMT database.
segment.target: VAMT has been installed and computers have been added to the VAMT database.

segment.source: See Parts 1 through 4 in either Scenario 1: Online Activation or Scenario 2: Proxy Activation for more information.
segment.target: See Parts 1 through 4 in either Scenario 1: Online Activation or Scenario 2: Proxy Activation for more information.

segment.source: Activate KMS Clients
segment.target: Activate KMS Clients

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: To set the KMS activation options, on the menu bar click View.
segment.target: To set the KMS activation options, on the menu bar click View.

segment.source: Then click Preferences to open the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box.
segment.target: Then click Preferences to open the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box.

segment.source: In the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box, under KMS Management Services host selection select from the following options:
segment.target: In the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box, under KMS Management Services host selection select from the following options:

segment.source: Find a KMS host automatically using DNS.
segment.target: Find a KMS host automatically using DNS.

segment.source: This is the default setting.
segment.target: This is the default setting.

segment.source: VAMT will instruct the computer to query the Domain Name Service (DNS) to locate a KMS host and perform activation.
segment.target: VAMT will instruct the computer to query the Domain Name Service (DNS) to locate a KMS host and perform activation.

segment.source: If the client contains a registry key with a valid KMS host, that value will be used instead.
segment.target: If the client contains a registry key with a valid KMS host, that value will be used instead.

segment.source: Find a KMS host using DNS in this domain for supported products.
segment.target: Find a KMS host using DNS in this domain for supported products.

segment.source: Select this option if you use a specific domain, and enter the name of the domain.
segment.target: Select this option if you use a specific domain, and enter the name of the domain.

segment.source: Use specific KMS host.
segment.target: Use specific KMS host.

segment.source: Select this option for environments which do not use DNS for KMS host identification, and manually enter the KMS host name and select the KMS host port.
segment.target: Select this option for environments which do not use DNS for KMS host identification, and manually enter the KMS host name and select the KMS host port.

segment.source: VAMT will set the specified KMS host name and KMS host port on the target computer, and then instruct the computer to perform activation with the specific KMS host.
segment.target: VAMT will set the specified KMS host name and KMS host port on the target computer, and then instruct the computer to perform activation with the specific KMS host.

segment.source: In the left-side pane, in the Products node, click the product that you want to activate.
segment.target: In the left-side pane, in the Products node, click the product that you want to activate.

segment.source: In the products list view in the center pane, sort the list if necessary.
segment.target: In the products list view in the center pane, sort the list if necessary.

segment.source: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.
segment.target: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.

segment.source: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.
segment.target: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.

segment.source: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.
segment.target: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.

segment.source: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.
segment.target: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.

segment.source: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.
segment.target: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.

segment.source: Click Filter.
segment.target: Click Filter.

segment.source: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.
segment.target: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.

segment.source: Select the products that you want to activate.
segment.target: Select the products that you want to activate.

segment.source: Click Activate in the Selected Items menu in the right-side Actions pane, click Activate, point to Volume activate, and then click the appropriate credential option.
segment.target: Click Activate in the Selected Items menu in the right-side Actions pane, click Activate, point to Volume activate, and then click the appropriate credential option.

segment.source: If you click the Alternate Credentials option, you will be prompted to enter an alternate user name and password.
segment.target: If you click the Alternate Credentials option, you will be prompted to enter an alternate user name and password.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Activating products dialog box until it completes the requested action.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Activating products dialog box until it completes the requested action.

segment.source: When activation is complete, the status appears in the Action Status column of the dialog box.
segment.target: When activation is complete, the status appears in the Action Status column of the dialog box.

segment.source: Click Close to close the dialog box.
segment.target: Click Close to close the dialog box.

segment.source: You can also click the Automatically close when done check box when the dialog box appears.
segment.target: You can also click the Automatically close when done check box when the dialog box appears.

segment.source: The same status is shown under the Status of Last Action column in the products list view in the center pane.
segment.target: The same status is shown under the Status of Last Action column in the products list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: VAMT Step-by-Step Scenarios
segment.target: VAMT Step-by-Step Scenarios
